dt.t: The children enjoyed the lively manner with which she {wi}narrated{/wi} her life's story.

dt: {bc}to provide spoken commentary for (something, such as a movie or television show)

dt.t: The documentary is {it}narrated{/it} by a famous actor.

et: Latin {it}narratus{/it}, past participle of {it}narrare{/it}, from Latin {it}gnarus{/it} knowing; akin to Latin {it}gnoscere, noscere{/it} to know {ma}{mat|know|}{/ma}
shortdef: to tell (a story) in detail; also : to provide spoken commentary for (something, such as a movie or television show)
